{{Infobox software | name = Voyager | logo = [[Image:Voyager-logo.png]] | screenshot = | caption = | developer = [[VaporWare (company)|VaporWare]] | latest_release_version = 3.2 | latest_release_date = 2000-04-16 | latest preview version = 3.3.126 | latest preview date =2002-12-23 | operating_system = [[AmigaOS]], [[MorphOS]] | platform = [[Amiga]] | genre = [[Web browser]] | license = [[Proprietary software|Proprietary]] | website = [http://www.vapor.com/voyager/ www.vapor.com/voyager/] }}
'''Voyager''' is a [[web browser]] for the [[Amiga]] range of computers, developed by [[VaporWare (company)|VaporWare]].
Voyager supports [[HTML]] 3.2 and some HTML 4, [[JavaScript]], frames, [[Transport Layer Security|SSL]], [[Macromedia Flash|Flash]], and various other [[Internet Explorer]] and [[Netscape Navigator]] features.
Voyager is also available for the [[MorphOS]] and [[CaOS]] operating systems.
Voyager is the also the name of a completely different web browser available for the [[QNX]]<ref>http://www.qnx.com/products/middleware/graphics/voyager.html</ref> operating system.
==Voyager 1== {{Empty section|date=May 2008}}
==Voyager 2== {{Empty section|date=May 2008}}
==Voyager 3==
In May 1999 Oliver Wagner of VaporWare gave details of the upcoming Voyager 3 to [[Amiga Format]], with planned new features including support for [[Javascript]], [[Document Object Model|DOM]] (based on [[Internet Explorer]]'s model), and [[Cascading Style Sheets|CSS]].<ref>Amiga Format News, "Voyager 3 features announced", ''Amiga Format'', June 1999 (issue 124), 11</ref>
Voyager 3 was generally well-received, with Amiga Format praising its fast Javascript execution and rapid table layout, but criticising its 'virtually unusable' print function and out-of-date documentation.<ref>Richard Drummond, "Voyager3", ''Amiga Format'', March 2000 (issue 134), 38</ref>
